column1: Yeah about 10 years ago I had a horrifying experience. It was 100% their fault but they hit the water barrels and survived. They had no injuries but they almost ran me off the road.	That's really scary. Were you in a vehicle?
No I wasn't hit. It turned out they were drunk. I felt guilty but realized it was his fault.	That's good. I hope you got the sense to say sorry, but also don't feel bad about yourself.

I don't know I was new to driving and hadn't experienced anything like that. I felt like my horn made him swerve into the water barrels.	Well, can you tell me about your experience? I think we swapped places	Well, I am not sure. I do not know you
Oh my goodness, that's very scary! I hope you are okay now and the drunk driver was punished for his actions?	I'm glad I'm okay. That's just the worst!
I there, dont know what to do, jst broke up with my girlfirned, we were 8 years together	That sucks, I am sorry to hear that.
Yes we decided together with our minds, and know i come home and feel so distant from the world	That sounds great. It's always good to have someone to talk to.
I couldn't wait to go to the concert.	Oh, that's awesome. What kind of music did you like?
The U2 concert. Tickets were really expensive and I never thought we would be able to go, but somehow we did!!!	That is awesome! I bet you were so excited!
I'm so sad because i've read an article about a newborn girl who died because her parents didn't believe in medication and doctors	Oh no, that is terrible.  How did she die?
she was born premature at home, she had hard time breathing on her own but instead of taking her to the doctor parents were just praying	That is so sad.  How is she doing now?

yes! And i do believe in God and prayers but goodness gracious please take your children to the hospital and let God heal them THROUGH doctors	so my friend's baby fell down and scraped his knee yesterday and i was trying so hard to cheer him up	That's good, how did it happen?
i was singing nursery songs :)	What were you singing?
If you happy and you know it :)	my husband lost a job but i'm hoping he can find a full time job soon	That's great news! I hope it's not a long time before you both have a steady income again.
thank you so much!	What was it?
he is an armed guard	i just moved to this neighborhood and some dumb criminals shot one of my neighbors and ran into the woods!	That is so sad. Were you able to get the police?
I do! I want to be able to protect my son	I know how you feel.
i'm so excited because i'm finally going to visit my parents next month! I didn't see them for 3 years	That is awesome! What are you going to do?
I moved to the US and they stayed in my homecountry	That's too bad.  How long have you been here?

I was very angry when a co worker lied about a car accident to get out of working July 4th. I covered his shift till midnight and he was lying about the accident	That's a terrible thing to do. I would have been furious!
Yeah he got caught in someones pics on Facebook. Never lie and then go out with people who like to take pictures.	That's so rude. Do you know who got caught?

Good idea. i don't like social media that much. It can get you in to trouble fast, even when expressing your opinions.	So yeah i drove 2 hours to get to wallmart. with 299 in my wallet as advertised, and the real price of the tv was 399 usd. what a bummer	That's crazy. I'm sure you were disappointed.
Yeah i had my hopes reall high and then i left empty handed, such a terrible feeling!	I know, it's so frustrating.

Yes, i guess walmart and the rest of false advertisement in the US, the look in my daugther eyes when i came home empty handed	My friend's boyfriend recently made a pass at me. I'm married, and I also am really good friend's with his girlfriend so I felt really bad. I made sure he knew I was loyal and honest to both!	That is very nice of you! I have been in a situation like that.

I struggled with it, but my friend was in a really bad spot, with no income and raising her grandchild, he was the financial supporter. So, I didn't tell her, as I knew it would really hurt her in several ways, plus she really loves him!	That is very kind of you, but you should have told her.
my baby is sleeping. it's so peaceful and quiet in this house	Oh that's awesome. I am jealous!
i totally agree with you!	I'm glad we agree on something!
hi, i feel so lonely sometimes because all my friends live in a different country	I understand, I live in a different country as well, it can be hard sometimes.
i was thinking about it! I wanted to join a group for local moms	That sounds like fun! What did you end up doing?

I have a friend that has a child that is unruly and does bad things. One day at our home, he grabbed a game and sat on it, instantly breaking it! It was expensive and this really irked me, especially because she doesn't discipline him when he does bad things.	I am so sorry that happened to you.  That is so not what I would expect from a parent.

Me either! I have two of my own children, and I would have never let them get away with that kind of behavior when they were his age. I just don't understand those kind of parents@!	That is so true! It's like, they are so young and they just don't understand the world yet!
I'm so scared of bugs! i found one in my hair yesterday and almost died	I am with you. I hate bugs.

Ugh I hate bugs with a passion, they are so creepy	I recently spoke with my ex-girlfriend on the phone. The conversation went pretty well, and it reminded me of my past experiences with her.	That's great. What was the conversation like?
Yes, they ended somewhat well, but there were tense moments. I am glad she's doing well, but I miss her.	That's good to hear.  I bet she's doing well.  You must miss her.
Thank you! That means a lot.	One of the times I remember feeling the most blissed out in life was right after the birth of my first child.	I bet you felt so happy!

Obviously there are the demands of a new child -- but that feeling of finally meeting someone you waited so long for, and the love surrounding the whole situation. Truly something to remember.	That is very true, I am sure that feeling is very special.

Have you ever been in a situation when payment of some kind has come through *just* in the nick of time?! Talk about gratitude!	I have, and I just got my taxes done.  It was a bit stressful, but it was worth it.

Absolutely. You go from scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic in one quick moment! It's not a situation I wish to be in again.	I've been there. I was in the military and I was in a bad place. I was in a bad place. But then I got out and I was able to get my life back on track.
Im so grateful for my family due to an incident with my friend	that must have been tough

My friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and their family was very close to mine. So seeing her go through the grief made me realize how thankful I should be	I am sorry to hear that.  I hope she recovers from it.

Yes definitely. Never take anything for granted as you never know when it will be taken away from you	I'm a big believer in listening to your gut. Sometimes I might wonder where my intuition is leading me, but it always seems to be spot on.	That is a good way to live

It is a "knowing" -- and a flowing! When something is right, it just feels easier to go with it -- like you're being led, even if you might not fully know to where.	That sounds so peaceful.  Is that something you can experience in your life?
I couldnt celebrate my 18th birthday as I had exams during the time and I felt terrible for it. But my friends threw a surprise party for me and it was the best!	I am sure you were happy

I was studying in my bedroom for a couple of hours straight with headphones on and then my mom called me to the living room for dinner and when I went out the whole place was decorated and everyone was there	Oh wow, that is so cool! I'm glad you had a good time!

I feel lonely sometimes cause I live in a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and sometimes they are all hanging out with their significant others and I feel lonely	That's really sad. I can't imagine having to live with all those girls.

Sometimes they joke about it and obviously I make it look like its totally fine cause I dont want to give them the impression that I am lonely but it does hurt sometimes	I bet.  Are you going to your sister or mom?

As silly as it sounds, I was so surprised at how different my two kids were as babies. You're reminded that they're wired with their own personalities from the git-go.	I agree, and it is a nice feeling when you have a child that you can be proud of.

One was pacifier, one was fingers. One wanted to co-sleep, one liked her space. One liked facing *out* in the Baby Bjorn carrier, one liked cocooning in a sling!	I had a baby boy and a baby girl. I always loved having them co-sleep.
The other day I had a deep craving for Chik-Fil-A.	I love that place. Did you go there?
Mine too. So I drive there and pull in the parking lot and it's completely empty. I then realized it was Sunday.	Wow, I am impressed.  What was you doing on Sunday?

I visited an orphan once and it was such a surreal moment. It made me realise how thankful I should be for a family	I have been in a similar situation once, it was so heartbreaking. I am glad you are thankful for your family.
Yes it definitely was. I went with intentions to teach the kid a few things but I ended up learning lots more from him	I love this type of thing.  It's a great way to connect with kids.
My oldest and my husband have always had a rough relationship. I've got to believe that as she gets older, it will get better!	I hope so!  I can only imagine how tough it must be for them.

That's always good to hear. But in the moment -- argh, my *heart*. How did your mom maneuver the differences between y'all? Did that wear on her?	I'm sure she was very understanding. I'm sure she was very patient.

But in the meantime -- the unspoken strain is NOT fun. But I'm glad to hear about a happy ending -- thank you for that!	I can still look back with shame at the way I treated a girl in sixth grade. I wasn't as bad as others, but that doesn't make me feel any better.	I am so sorry to hear that. It's not cool to treat someone that way.

Well, like a lot of 6th graders I was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. And unfortunately, she was. As an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!	That is so sad. What happened to her?
Unfortunately, she died. I only found out when Facebook first came out, and her brother and I "friended" one another.	I am so sorry to hear that.  Did you have a close relationship?

I'm currently working for someone that is *such* a great example of a leader! It makes going into work inspiring every day / every way.	That's awesome! I've been working for a company that has a very different culture.

That's a very kind statement, and certainly what I would strive for. And it's the rarity that *inspires* me. That should be the norm, not the exception! THAT'S what I'd like to inspire in people. How about you?	I am inspired by the fact that there is someone who actually cares. It's a great feeling.
That is soul-sapping. What do you do to inspire yourself, and not let that kind of behavior drag you down?	I don't have the same issues as some people, but I'm sure it's very hard for others.
My friend's baby has grown so much since the last time I had seen her!	I bet she's getting to be a big girl.
It had been about 8 weeks - I don't get out her way often, even though we live 30 minutes away.	That's not too bad. What do you do when you do go out?

Yes!  I got to be 'auntie' for a bit and help change her and get her fed and down for a nap while my friend had a chance to toss laundry in the wash.  It was a good day for everyone!	Running my first (and maybe only!) marathon felt like *such* a huge accomplishment!	I bet!  What was your time?
Ah, it was the best! Plus it helped that I purposely chose an amazing destination in which to run it -- it was the Venice Marathon!	That was a great choice!  Did you have fun?
We were living overseas at the times -- the most impressive part was crossing the Grand Canal over a pontoon of boats to finish the marathon ;-)	That sounds like a pretty cool experience!
I recently found out that a person I very much intimately admired did not feel the same way for me. I was pretty surprised.	Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that.
She just started treating me differently all of a sudden. And now she is going to be moving away soon.	Wow, she sounds like a bad person.
I'm always appalled when I see bullying in action -- whether it's on a playground or political stage -- not much makes me angrier.	I agree. It's a horrible thing to witness.

How do you channel the anger? Obviously, it too easily turns into the same kind of negative emotion I'm upset about -- so that can feel hypocritical!	I am sorry to hear that.  Is it a physical reaction?

Are you ever tempted to put anyone's face on the punching bag?! Ha! (Kidding/not kidding!)	One morning my mother came to my house to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat on the road and he had been hit. I had to tell my daughter about the loss of her beloved pet.	I am sorry to hear that. Losing a pet is never easy.
She was around 11, so she took it very hard. I went ahead and let her stay home from school, as I knew she wouldn't do well that day.	Oh, I see. That is very nice of you.
I was soooo excited to take our kids to Disneyland for the first time!	That sounds like so much fun! Did you get to go on any of the rides?

Same! I was excited because I grew up going there. My grandparents lived in Tucson, and we would spend the summers with them -- the most exciting part being our drive to Disneyland each year!	That sounds so fun.  I live in the East and I've never been to Disneyland.

California! Old school ;-) They've kept so much of the original, while adding lots of new attractions.	I recently spoke to my father for the first time in years. It reminded me of my childhood and the distant past.	I am sure it was nice to reconnect with him.
We spoke about our recent lives. Apparently he is in the market for a new car.	I love cars. What kind?
Do you like to organize your house.  My mother-in-law recently surprised me recently with some organizing stuff b/c she knows how much I love it!	I do, but I don't have a house.
Labels and Bins can be your best friend!  Especially with a new baby.	I love labels and bins. I have a whole section in my kitchen dedicated to cleaning supplies and snacks.
I find it odd -- and annoying -- when people don't respond to or even acknowledge emails.	I know what you mean. I have been doing that for years.

It would be great if there was a way we could all tell the best way to reach someone -- I know some people prefer texts to emails -- but if you're in a work situation, how do you ensure communication?	I think it would be great to have a universal way of communicating.
I recently had a big argument with my sister. We both got very upset and angry at each other.	That's terrible. Why did it happen?
I'm not so sure. We just had a discussion that heated and became an argument with tempers flying.	That's scary.  I'm glad you were able to resolve the issue.

I felt most lonely when we first moved overseas, my husband then had to travel out of *that* country for business -- AND I had a new baby!	That's a lot of change. But it's a great opportunity to make new friends.
From Santa Fe to Hong Kong -- ultimately a fantastic adventure. And I ended up with a wonderful group of friends. Expats bond quickly!	I am so jealous! I love travel!
One of the saddest things to me is when people underestimate what they can do and/or are capable of.	That's a common thing I see.  What do you mean?

That's perfectly natural. You sound like the kind of person, though, that quickly regained their bearings. Disappointments like that usually come with some *good* lessons.	You're right. Sometimes it's hard to see, but in the end, it's a good thing. You can't really regret the good things, though.

Once my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was busy that day when she needed his help but I told her anyway.  I really felt bad b/c he got pretty upset with me.	Wow, I'm sorry to hear that.  I hope he has forgiven you.

Yeah thats a good question.  I totally deserved him being mad.  I just felt bad for him b/c he was so busy that day and I didn't want him to have one more thing on his plate I guess	That's a good thing you did.

There was a back neighbor that called my 10 year old son a ugly name one time, simply because he entered her yard slightly when he rode around the corner.!	Oh man. That's horrible. I would be so mad. Did you tell your mom about it?

Yes, she lived several house back and she didn't know me, until after she did that! She knew me then, but after I talked to her, she apologized to both of us.	That is a very nice thing to do, it's always nice to have someone's apology, it shows you care about them and not just a person.

Too often, it's a health scare that makes us value health. It inspires me to try and do something to keep healthy every day.	I'm glad you are trying to take care of your health. I'm trying to do the same.

Happily, I don't have one! It's more seeing family and friends and the situations they're in. Not everything can be helped -- but there are some things we can all do to take care of ourselves, you know?	That's very true. I see a lot of people who do have one and they're very sad.

Every time I look through older photos of my children, I'm taken right back to the time they were that size, and what we were doing! It's a bittersweet feeling, for sure.	I can relate! My kids are grown now and I look at old photos and it makes me think about how far they've come.
Are your kids adults now?	I'm not sure, but I'm not sure I want to be a parent again.

I have an 18 year old as well -- I don't know about you, but it's hard to consider her an adult sometimes!	I have a hard time having confidence in myself but when I got married and I had my hair and makeup done I felt like I was beautiful!  I had so much confidence in myself that day and it was great!	I bet that was a fun experience for you.  Did you do it yourself or was it done by another person?
I really try but it's hard to replicate that day for sure.	I feel you.  I've never been able to replicate a day that I was happy with.

My husband and I both work for ourselves -- a blessing and a curse at times, since it can be tough to determine a "regular" income.	I can understand that. Do you feel like you are in a good financial situation?
We found a pretty good balance in that I have a part-time job that I *love* -- and that comes with benefits like insurance. That's a big worry addressed, right there.	What is your part time job?
I am sorry, because I absolutely know that concern. I truly hope you find a resolution to that.	I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected	What happened?
Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfriend.	Oh no, did you like him?

I know right! No warning or anything. He turned out to be a nice guy, but I thought it was a little misleading on her part.	My family and I are going on vacation in a few weeks. We rented a largo beachfront condo and I can't wait!	That sounds wonderful! I am jealous!

We are going to be staying at Miramar Beach in Florida, about an  hour Panama City Beach. The view is amazing from our balcony and we are so ready!	That sounds so beautiful. I've never been there. How many days do you plan to stay there?
I was supposed to go for brunch with my friend Maria the other day. At least that was the plan.	Oh no! Was anything else going on?
Well, we had initially agreed to meet at 11. Wouldn't you know it, she didn't end up returning my text until 3PM!	Oh my god. That is so rude. I am so mad!
Me and my mom were at this grocery store recently and this guy started following us outside the store and then again inside the store it was so scary!	Wow, what happened?

Well I knew he was following us and so I asked the manager to walk us out to the car and when he did we saw the guy come out again from between the two buildings b/c he was waiting on us.  so scary!	That sounds really scary! Did you ever see him again?
Did I tell you what happened with Li the other night? Boy do I feel dumb.	Oh no what happened?

She's 45 minutes late to our anniversary dinner. I don't know what happened to me but I called and left an angry message. Turns out, she had gotten T-boned at an intersection and was talking to the Police Officer when I called!	Wow, that's a pretty lame excuse! I would be very angry too.
Ugh! I looked like such a fool at my girlfriend's work party!	Oh no! What happened?

Well, I ended up having way too much to drink. One of her co-workers had a bottle of Fireball (gross I KNOW) and was making everybody do shots. I didn't want to look foolish, so I had... well too many.	I am sorry to hear that.  Did you end up getting in trouble?
Did I tell you what happened with the concert I was supposed to go to Saturday?	Oh no, what happened?
Well first of all, it wasn't just any concert - it was Jay-Z and Beyonce! AND IT GOT RAINED OUT!	That's a bummer. I'm sorry you didn't get to see it.
You are never going to guess who was sleeping on the couch when I got home from New York...	I bet it was a friend of yours?
My friend Benny! The one we all thought died in a monsoon in Thailand!	Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that.  Did he survive?

Recently, my husband came home from grocery shopping and had gifts for me for Mother's Day. He had a beautiful diamond ring and other lovely gifts, it was very unexpected!	Oh wow! That is amazing! I love that he would surprise you like that!
I did! I also gave him unexpected gifts and he was super happy. I was very touched by him being so thoughtful!	That is so sweet of you! I bet he was glad you were so kind to him.
I know I shouldn't count my chicks before they hatch, but I'm feeling pretty good after that interview today!	I am glad to hear that! You must feel pretty good about it.
This advertising company! The owner was there - you should have seen his face. My last freelance project was a real winner. Think I got it?	Oh I think so, I'm not sure.
Did I ever tell you about the time I "got taken hostage"?	How did that happen?

As a heart attack. It was me and Big C at the World's Largest Pistachio. All of the sudden we hear gunshots, and DiDi's still in the car. We ran in the building, and he comes flying in after us. He never pointed the gun at us, and we ended up running away when he was distracted. It's too crazy - I can't make this up. Just glad to be alive!	That is crazy, I bet you were scared.

I went to visit a friend one day and her boyfriend made a pass at me. He actually suddenly kissed me, as I was waiting for my friend to return. I couldn't believe his nerve!	That is so rude! I would be so angry!

I quietly pushed him away, as I didn't want my friend to hear. I was so shocked and upset, since he knew I wouldn't want to make a scene and took advantage.	Oh, that is awful. I am so sorry. I bet you are still hurt.

This past Friday night our refrigerator stopped cooling! We had to go the weekend without it, and of course had to deal with some unpleasant smells and throw away a large amount of food! It wasn't a fun weekend for us!	That sounds awful! Did you call a repairman?

Yes, and of course we tried to call and have someone come out, but to no avail! You don't realize how much you rely on things like that until they aren't working!	Yeah, I know what you mean. I was so frustrated and left my house!

I felt pretty bad when I was having girl talk with my friend and we were talking about our partners. Her boyfriend had made a pass at me, but I never told her about it.	That is not good.  What did you do?

I felt bad, but she wasn't working and taking care of her grandchild, and her boyfriend was the financial support. I knew it would really be hard on her if she found out, not to mention she really loves him.	That's not very nice of you.  I hope she finds someone who is a better fit for her.
I was at the mall and hug my mom and said to her: Time to go Mommy! and i wasnt her, can you imagine my reaction to it?	I would be so shocked!
Yes, totally but at the moment i felt like the stupidiest person on earth, didn't know were to hide! and my mom was watching	That is the worst! I bet she was shocked

THe good thing about it, was the lady, she was laughing and later told me that it has happened to her childrens to, no worries!	I am looking forward to going on vacation in a few weeks! We have a condo reserved on the beach, with fantastic ocean views. I'm ready!	That sounds great! What are you going to do while you are there?
Well, we are staying at Panama City Beach, so we're right there at the Gulf of Mexico.	Oh, I love the Gulf. I have always wanted to visit there.
I am definitely a proud parent of our 15 year old -- she was determined to work this summer, and even with us saying no one would hire her until 16 -- she found a job!	That's awesome! How old is she?

That, and she's enjoying the independence of having her own money. Remember that? Making money that you truly could use for your *pleasure* (and not just necessities ?! ;-))	Oh yeah, I remember that. I was so happy to be able to buy the things I wanted and not have to save up for them.

Same! I was surprised 15 year olds *can* actually work during the summer. It's just finding an employer who knows those hours get cut WAY back once school starts.	Okay, a silly pet peeve but one nonetheless -- when people just leave their grocery carts willy-nilly in the parking lot. No consideration for others or the people who work at the store!	Oh wow. That's a pet peeve of mine too. I don't know why people don't clean up after themselves.
Me too. And I will always make sure to at *least* put it in one of those cart corrals, if not walk it back up to the store. Hey -- extra exercise ;-)	That's great, are you a regular at the store?
WE CAN SAVE THE WOOOOOOORLD!!!!! (lol indeed....!)	I came home, and my wife showed me a picture in 4d of our future baby, my heart speeded so fast!	That is awesome!  Did you have any kids?
We choose to wait! but the amount of happiness in my body is tremendous! never felt this way before.	That is awesome! What are you waiting for?

Yes, God willing the baby is going to be healthy in every way! can wait to ave the second	I love being in the "flow" -- whether it's in speaking to a group of people or working to help facilitate meetings.	That sounds really nice.

I work with different organizations on strengthening their culture, and I do large-scale visual notetaking (also known as graphic recording). Are you familiar with that at all? (Not unusual NOT to be!)	I have no idea what that is.  I'm not sure I understand it.

That's one of the huge benefits -- learning about many different industries and subjects!	I LOVE when leaders know that it actually *helps* them to be surrounded by strong people -- people they can learn from, that challenge them, and that in some ways could be considered "better".	That is a good point, I think that is one of the things that I like about a leader that you can trust to know how to surround themselves with good people.

It's just too many leaders want "yes men" and/or people who feel non-threatening. It's a trap and a quick path to mediocrity, if not failure!	I completely agree with you.  It's so hard to find someone who will actually take risks and be honest with you.  It's like they want to get away with it!

I'll always remember the day I learned I was pregnant with our first child -- Halloween in Chicago, and we were with friends at the Shedd Aquarium! I've loved baby belugas since ;-)	I love baby belugas!

Ha! True that ;-) That's also the year that A Bug's Life came out, and we always thought of our young one as "Dot", the spunky little girl ant in the movie.	What a great movie. I have seen it several times.
This mother's day was amazing! I got so much more than expected and it was all so heartfelt	That's great! What did you get?
Yes, definitely! I actually cried a few times because of how much thought went into each gift and what was written in the cards	That's great! You must be a very thoughtful person.
THat's too bad. What do you think went wrong?	I think it was the guy who was supposed to pick up my car. He forgot.
Did they give you any feedback?	Yeah, they did, they said I was too aggressive. I'm so upset!
That is a shame, you need to learn from your mistakes.	I agree, we should learn from our mistakes.

So my sister told us a couple weeks ago she was pregnant. Her and her husband are so excited. I hope they have an amazing 9 months and then an amazing time raising the baby.	I'm sure they will.  Is she pregnant with a boy or girl?
I was very surprised. She didn't tell a single person they were trying for a baby. Just announced it on the 4th of July	That is so sweet! I would have been so surprised if I had found out!
Yes, they put a picture of their sonogram on the tv and waited for someone to notice it. So exciting	Oh no, what did you do instead? Did you watch Netflix?	yea i was watching the show "black-ish"
Yes, I do. I recently watched the series "Dark." It's the German one.	I have heard of that series. I didn't watch it.
It's a supernatural mystery type. I won't spoil the twist.	You're kidding, right?

It was fantastic, a lot of people have been comparing it to Stranger Things, but its a lot more grime and serious.	I went to a court hearing for unemployment with my former employer, and I felt great about it since I was so prepared with all of the documents and everything I needed to show the court I was in the right for quitting.	Well, I'm glad you were prepared! It's good that you were confident in your case.
Yes, I actually ended up winning it and they gave me 6 months of unemployment pay.	oh wow thats amazing, what were you doing?

Yes I am currently working as a processing assistant at a warehouse. I love it. Much better than my last job	Today traffic was horrible and was so frustrating!	I know, it's so annoying when it's bad.  I always hate when it's bad.
Yes! People were constantly cutting me off,not signalling and slamming on their brakes	I am sorry to hear that.
The grudge scared me when I was 10 to which I couldn't navigate my own house.	I am sorry to hear that, but it is nothing to be scared of, there are people who can help you.
And yet I still felt as if I had to see the sequels when they came out too.	Oh yeah. I hate when that happens. I know it's not fair, but you can't help but feel like you have to see them.

My best friend did amazing in school, despite having 2 children and not doing great academically in school. She ended up getting honors in her first 2 semesters.	That's awesome!  I've been struggling to get into college, but I feel like my best friend is really on track.  I'm sure she's got a good teacher.
She has been my friend for 19 years. She pushes me to do better too.	That is so cool. I am glad you have a good friend.

I hope you find someone like that. I believe everyone needs and deserves friends like that.	Today when I went outside to check my new banana plant I noticed the new leaf was turning brown.	I have never seen that happen before.
I don't think that's the problem. I am worried about a drainage issue. I'm going to check back in a couple days.	I'm sure it's not the problem.  You'll figure it out.

I'm new to growing bananas and from what I understand they can be very sensitive to over-watering. It was doing great before today. Possibly wind too.	I decided a few months I was ready for a puppy, so I put the word out	Oh really? What kind of puppy?

Yeah, especially because we were single income. My mom homeschooled my brother and I. I think he took only a handful of sick days his entire time working, had something like 600 days saved up when he retired.	That's really smart of her.
I think he got 3 weeks a year, only used like 5 days.	That's not a lot of time for work

ye and so I had to leave the country because of her	I'm sorry to hear that. Is everything okay now?

yes. Well it was a long time ago but I haven't forgotten	What happened?

Now the remake is well on its way. Maybe it can lift this depression I feel if they stay true to the story. Jason Mamoa isn't bad looking	I think the original was a lot better. I'm happy to hear that they're making one.
I had to adapt to life. I had to change to survive. Now I feel better	Oh, that's so true, I had to adapt to life too.

Very angry and frustrated that she would behave that way. It makes me think less of her as a person.	Oh yeah, it's no fun to be around people who do that.

Thanks! It was a huge challenge, and I'm SO glad to have it behind me!	That's great! How long did it take you to finish?

yes, They thought that I have some extraordinary talent and that is the reason I got that position	That's great!  What position is it?

every time I try not to hit that cone but those are so close.	I know right?

It does. I worked really hard to pass the acceptance tests, and I couldn't believe when I passed with flying colors!	That's great.  You must be proud!

It was just very creepy situation	I'm sorry, what happened?
lol thats funny	My hubby lost his job a couple of months ago but he has an interview this friday so i pray he will get that job	That is good news.  I hope he does get it and you get the job too.
armed security	I am so scared of them. I have been carrying a gun for years.

no, I was on a 10th floor and security was down. I was scared even with a single noise.	Oh no! I'm glad you made it out.
I have been awarded with a degree in marketing.	That's great! Congratulations!
it took 4 years but at last got it	I'm so happy for you! What did you get?
Yeah,  I have  a job that I was looking for and now I am really enjoying my life.	Hey, have you ever been in a car wreck?	No, I haven't. I don't think I would be very brave enough.

Have you everr been in a fist fight with anyone?	I haven't but I have been in a few.

Have you ever played and old video game called Everquest?	I haven't. Is it good?
It came out in 1999. I used to play it when i was a teen. I installed it the other day and had a good time playing.	That's cool.  What kind of game is it?
Have you ever eaten at Hardee's?	I have. I love it.
I like it too, but I'm not a big fan of their new sliders. They're so tiny, and just one of them cost almost 2 dollars!	Well, that's too bad! I don't get it, but I love their burgers.

Yes I agree, she was so happy when she found out the job was hers	That's great! What job?

Yeah she has a passion for teaching. These kids will be great to work with.	So about a year ago now, my girlfriend decided to surprise me with a puppy!	I'm glad she did! I'm sure it was very fun to have a puppy in the house!
Yes, so nice!! It was the best thing that could've happened! It's a German Shepherd!	That's awesome. I love dogs.

There was this one time I was fairly drunk at a bar and this attractive girl was trying to make moves on me, but I did my best to ignore it all.. Having a girlfriend and all.	That is very nice of you. I hope you won her heart.
I was very proud definitely when I woke up the next morning and knew no mistakes were made!	Wow, that's good to hear! What happened?

There was this one time my girlfriend and I had plans to meet a Longhorn steakhouse for a date.. She ended up keeping me waiting inside 30 extra minutes! I was pretty frustrated.	I bet you were. Did she apologize?
Yes, she actually had a legit reason so I couldn't be too mad at her.. She definitely made it up to me!	You must be very happy!
I'm just so happy it's finally Friday!	Did you do anything fun this week?
i just want to sleep in and then watch movies all day long... but i'm a mom so i don't sleep in. ever	That's a tough life. I'm sure you're very good at it though.
I had to cancel a trip to see my brother after it started snowing heavily.	Oh no, did you have to find another way to go?
Yes, when the snow builds up on the road I get nervous, and during this trip I couldn't even see where the road was and where the ditch began.	I can imagine, it's a pretty scary situation.
It sure can.  When I decided that I wasn't comfortable driving in such deep snow I literally turned around and went home.	That would have been a good idea.

It does definitely get easier over time I suppose.. Now that I see my life I guess it was for the best.	That is a good point. I have been thinking the same thing.

There was one day after work that my girlfriend was planning a surprise party with a bunch of friends and family.	That's sweet! I would have loved to be there.
Yes, the party was for me! I was so shocked and had no clue it was coming.	That is nice.

Because I really liked it, and didn't think he'd care.	Why didn't he care?

I mainly just played video games and watched tv.	That sounds like a pretty lazy way to spend your time.

Because here in my area in Florida, there isn't too many options for me.	I am sorry to hear that. Is it a problem with the area?

She got me a brand new laptop I had been wanting for gaming!	What kind of laptop is it?

I went on this ride at the beach called the Slingshot.. It shoots you super high up in the air.. It was so teriffying, I had so much faith in the ride I wouldn't die!	I've never been on a Slingshot. What did you do on it?
It was seriously so scary, I almost pooped myself!	What happened?

Well I get super jealous and angry of course.. But in the end it was just a work friend.. Oops!	That is unfortunate. I'm sorry to hear that.
My dog randomly got up on my couch last week, and just started peeing.. Like what!?!?!??!?!	I would be mad. Did you scold him?
Not since lunch, so it's actually been about 4 hours.. I hate living on the top floor!	That must be so frustrating. Are you in a new apartment?

Yes, I am so proud of myself for finally accomplishing it!	That's great! What did you accomplish?

No.. I realized the mistake I made and took action so it never would happen again.	Oh wow, I am sorry to hear that.
There was this one time I was driving down the road, and this guy on a sports bike popped a wheelie.. It was so sick!	Oh wow.  What did you do?
I know! I do too.. I think I need to learn to ride a sports bike first.. Hehe oops!	Oh man, I think you need to get a helmet and a bike before you try to ride one!
When i was younger, I came back to the house with my family to find our family pet dead.	That's terrible. I hope you are doing okay.
He was very old, so I guess we were all expecting it.. He lived a good life!	That's great. I'm glad he lived a good life.

Oh dang, I guess I can't complain too much then, that's brutal!	What happened?
I have to go to confession at the church... i was a little mean to my mom, sometimes its difficult to be always nice	I'm sure she'll forgive you!  What did you do?
Well yes when i shouted and i inmeaditelly apologize but i feel really bad	Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that. What happened?
We walked, we ate ice cream, we rode a bike, we laughed a lot, we enjoyed the outdoors, we were exhausted	Oh that sounds like a lot of fun! Did you have a good time?
I had time that I did not share with the children and that was something that was pending in my soul	I know what you mean. I feel the same way about my wife.
Sometimes one gives priority to work	The world is very beautiful	It is, but I love my home.
Exactly. Look at the beautiful scenery around you. Nature at its very best. I am surprised people don't notice	I know right? I have been in nature so much lately. I am getting a little crazy from it.

People are getting busy everyday with other stuff and they forget to breathe fresh air. Leads to s stressful life	I can remember feeling so disillusioned when someone who I really admired as a visionary turned out to be a real jerk on a day-to-day basis.	What was their name?

Well, it definitely makes you a little more realistic when you may be tempted to put someone on a pedestal. Not really fair to them *or* to yourself, is it?	That is a good point.  I was really impressed by the way the first lady handled the situation.

As a kid, I was SO frightened any time there was a tornado warning. Not sure if it was the Wizard of Oz effect or what -- I just remember being frozen with fear.	That's too bad. I don't get why people are afraid of tornadoes.

That's the thing -- NO! I mean, there were some that were kind of close -- but NOTHING like what so many folks have to deal with. I just remember wanting a basement sooooo badly -- not something that's common where I grew up!	Oh, I understand, I grew up in a basement.  That's the worst.

My mom said the best thing once when I was babysitting and a tornado warning went off and I didn't want my own fear to affect the little boy I was with -- she was on the phone and just said "You have big plans for the future, right? Nothing is going to get in the way of that." For some reason, it worked a charm ;-)	What did she mean by that?

I feel so bad when I think back to times that I got angry and yelled at my kids for no real good reason -- just a combination of the day's events and feeling irritated, really.	That is a common thing to do, I am sure you have done it before.

Yes! THAT I feel good about! Making a point to use it as an opportunity to talk. I've definitely used it when it comes to the way others might act -- emphasizing that it's not about *them*, it's really about the person and where they're at.	I have to agree, it's about people, not things.

I do look at that as a strength, in anyone. Being able to say "I'm sorry" and "I made a mistake."	I was SO excited the first time we were going to make an overseas move! I looked so forward to what I knew would be a life-changing adventure!	That sounds like a very exciting time! I have never made an overseas move.
I highly, highly recommend it. Not always easy -- culture shock *is* a thing! -- but such a great way to enhance one's perspective.	What did you like about it?
i would fear my gift	I hope you like it.
my partner gave me a an i phone it is very memorable and pleasure to me	That is great!  I would be happy to get an iPhone.  What kind did you get?
yes but its a valuable gift to me	That's nice. What is it?

he is an armed guard	That's good, how old is he?

yes, i even have glasses but because of astigmatism i don't see good at night even when i have glasses on	i have astigmatism too.  i see good in the day but not at night.

Yes! They cut in front, and bump into you. Plus being rude while they do it	That's terrible. I would be so angry.

I'm so sleep deprived and my baby wanted to play in the middle of the night and i just yelled at him :( i feel so terrible	I know, I'm sleep deprived too.  I'm so sorry to hear that.  I hope you get some rest soon.
i love being a mother but sleep deprivation is so horrible	I know, it's awful.
I love being around them and it's great to see them each year.	That's a great way to spend time with family.

O I'm sorry, my niece and nephews, only seem in the summer. Do you get company during the summer?	I do, but I don't get to see them as often as I would like.  I have a few close friends who are also parents of kids and they all get to have summers off.
My kids are going into 7th and 8th grade in a couple weeks. They really are growing up well	That's great. How are they doing?
My oldest daughter has some learning disabilities so I'm really proud of how she is doing. They're both growing up so fast	Oh that is so sad. I am so sorry to hear that.

rent and electricity. we've been struggling financially so it's such a relieve to pay bills	I'm sorry to hear that. I hope things get better for you.

i know! now i can spend the rest of the money on something cool	Oh man! You're going to have a blast!

no.. i love him. but he can be such a punk sometimes	I bet! Are you guys in a long distance relationship?

I tried to tell myself that, but my dad got into a really bad accident once, and it has scared me ever since.	Oh no, I'm so sorry to hear that. I hope you are not too traumatized by it.
I recently started learning to propagate my tomato plants by planting clipped off branches.	Oh cool. I've never done that before. I've always just left them to grow wild.

I do yes! and since the method i used is working, i have tons of tomatoes!	That's great! I hope you enjoy them!

Yes, exactly! They are always speeding or cutting you off. And of course no blinker use!	I hate that. I always get frustrated when people do that.

I'd say it's going pretty well, we eventually got married! How did you meet your friends?	I met my friend through our families.
OKay. I care for everyone	I bet you do. I'm glad to hear that.

because you gave me a compliment, which I feel is a genuine one	I recently had a one night stand with a woman from my past. It caught both of us off guard	I'm sorry to hear that. Was it a good experience?

She really is. It just shows that you don't need to have a four-year degree in order to be successful.	That is true, I used to be like that.

I think being with my husband makes me a better person	I agree. He must be a great partner.

Right? And no having to interact with others unless we choose too.	That is true. Some people just don't want to interact with others.

I was doing a presentation for work, and tried to tell a story about something kind of related to break the ice.  No one laughed or even really cracked a smile, so it put me off for the rest of the presentation.	That is unfortunate, did you try to tell a funny story?

That's a good idea.  I don't know where there's a dog park near me, I should look into that.	I love to go to the dog park and play with my dogs.

But beyond that. Small gestures make others' lives happier	My neighbor has a really annoying little dog that she always brings outside when she's smoking. A Pomeranian.  I don't have anything against that type of dog specifically, but this one is just terrible.	I'm sorry to hear that. Do you have a pet?

I think so ... I'm a little worried, because of the situation	I'm sorry to hear that. What's happening?

It's why I think getting a counselor is so important. No one should be expected to go through this on their own.	I was recently rejected by a person that I enjoyed. You can't always get what you want.	I agree.  There are a lot of people out there who don't appreciate the people in their lives.
Life is not fair, but it is also amazing in that we are here to begin with	That's true. I think we're all lucky in the sense that we get to live in this amazing world.

I'm a little anxious about an upcoming move. It's to a *very* different state with a *very* different climate and way of life!	Oh wow!  I can imagine.  That must be very scary.  I hope everything goes well and you enjoy the new place!

We've been great with change, including a few overseas moves under our belts. But this is to Anchorage! I've read a lot, and there's a lot to be excited about -- but man, those looooong winters!	Wow, I love Alaska, but I understand that the winters can be so cold and dark!
Ha! Not likely in the city....but hey...who knows! I WILL use the opportunity to finally learn how to cross country ski.	That sounds like a lot of fun!
The economy has been doing well. The future looks bright.	Yeah, it's been a great time to be living in America.
Hopefully prosperity will carry over into the next few generations.	I agree, prosperity is a great thing.

My sister unfortunately will not seek help for her alcohol problems, and she will not even admit to them. I am extremely sad apprehensive about what might happen to her.	That is very sad, is she in a relationship with someone?

I have been trying to get my family and her friends to have an intervention, but they have not agreed to it. She really needs one.	I'm sorry to hear that. What is she doing that you think she needs help with?
It was still so unexpected when my husband and I -- who were open to getting pregnant -- found out that we actually were!	That's so exciting!  I'm so glad you are both happy and healthy!

Oh, that was nearly 20 years ago ;-) But I'll always remember that Chicago day, Halloween, visiting the Shedd Aquarium with friends.	That sounds like a lot of fun.  I bet you have some great memories.

The thing I most remember were the beluga whales. So beautiful, in their own weird way -- and a baby beluga had just been born. It seemed provident!	Oh wow, that's a unique memory. What did you do with it?
The horror film I saw last night can cause nightmares. It was so scary!	I love horror movies. I'm sure it was scary.
I ended up watching The Ring! It was ridiculousness.	Did you have a good time?
My daughter was accepted into Harvard. She starts in the fall.	That's awesome!  I'm so happy for her!
She worked so hard and it's really expensive so I hope so!	I bet it is.  Are you going to support her?
My friend purchased a new car. The ride is sweet!	That sounds so nice, are you happy for him?
They ended up getting a Honda Prelude.	Did they have to pay for it?
I graduated college recently. I'm so glad!	I'm glad for you! What did you major in?
I majored in environmental engineering!	Oh, that's cool! Do you work with the environment?
I cheated on my girlfriend recently. I feel horrible about myself right now.	That is terrible, you should really be ashamed.
I plan on coming clean at some point, but I'm not sure how to break the news.	You will have to be brave.
I can not wait until some of my family come in to town. They will be coming in to town in two weeks.	What are you guys doing for the first time?
I saw them last summer which seems so long ago. I am very excited to see them because I am very close to them.	That's great, are they going to be together?
I often get nostalgic when I think back to my high school years. I had some very good friends.	That's nice. Do you still keep in touch with them?
Yes, I talk with several of them. I wish I had time to keep up with and talk to more though.	I'm sorry to hear that.
I saw a horror film last night! It was such a scary experience!	That's awesome! I love watching horror movies.
A young girl would come out of the TV if you watched a video.	That's cool. What kind of video?

I am not really a sentimental person but I always feel so special when my husband takes me back to the place we spent our anniversary	That is nice.  I always thought that was a nice thing for the man to do.
Yes, it is a very private Bed and Breakfast and we try to go back as often as we can.	That sounds like a fun place to stay. I bet it is very cozy and warm.
I was devastated when I recently had to my chihuahua Riley to sleep.  She had Congestive Heart Failure.	That's terrible. I'm sorry. I have a dog too.
Thank you.  She was my constant companion.  I loved her so much	That's really nice. How did you meet her?
I can not believe that Donald Trump became President. It just goes to show you that anyone can become President in the United States.	I agree. I was shocked when he won.
We shall see. I truly believe that he has done some much damage to our country in so many different ways.	I agree with you. I am concerned about the direction of our country.

Once I was suppose to go visit my sister and nieces who I hadn't seen in forever but I ended up breaking my heal and big toe and wasn't able to go. I was so upset!	I'm sorry to hear that! Did you get it fixed?
Yeah, hopefully so.  It isn't healing correctly is the problem or else I would just go in my cast.	That is very frustrating, I hope you get the healing you need.
Over the summer my family went to Alabama to visit family and I felt a lot of emotions	I'm glad you got to visit. Did you enjoy it?

No, I do not live in Alabama. We drove and trip was overall very good as sometimes it can be challenging when driving such a long distance	I've been to Alabama, it's a beautiful place. What was your trip for?
I was recently working on a project where unfortunately, my teammate really didn't pull their weight.	That is terrible.  I hope you guys can work it out.  What was the project?

Yep. Especially when you feel that you get dinged for the overall project. And at the same time, you don't want to complain about it, because it makes *you* look bad!	I'm so with you.  I've been there a few times.
I found out yesterday that I have a nest of yellow jacket bees in my front yard. They can be so aggressive.	I'm sorry to hear that.  They can be pretty nasty.

I will be able to take control of it myself as I have done so in the past. It still makes it difficult because I can not mow the grass until it gets taken care of.	I can understand that. It can be hard when you don't have a lot of control over things.

Since that earthquake in the early hours of the morning I realized how badly off I would be if I didn't get an emergency packet together. So that's what I did - cash, water, important documents, a change of clothing.	That's a good idea.  It's always better to be prepared.
It was enough to wake me, but not the cat, lol. It just made me realize that the Big One could happen any time and I would have been up the proverbial creek!	Oh, I hope you are not too scared!

Thank you, I will. It's just the price you pay to live in Paradise, right! At least now I won't die of thirst.	I went back to a horse ranch where I owned horses over 20 years ago. Good times	That sounds fun!  Did you get to ride the horses?
A paint (Black and white) and a red quarter horse	Oh wow! I don't even know what to say.

Horses are hard work but the fun is equal to the work.	The other day I had a flat, but I had my floor jack and 4-way lug wrench in my trunk and was able to get my tire changed and get back on the road within 10 minutes.	That is awesome! I am glad you were able to do that.
I've had so many flats in my life I've gotten quick at changing them.	I'm sorry to hear that. I hope you're okay.
One time, my friends were daring me to jump into a very cold spring from a height of around 40 feet. I was nervous, naturally.	That sounds scary. Did you do it?
Yeah, I ended up doing it. I jumped in and missed a rock wall by probably 2 feet. My legs went numb from the cold as soon as I landed.	Oh, I would have been very scared!

My dear friend Kris just started a job at a gorgeous golf resort on the shores of Lake Michigan. The green-eyed monster in me wants sooo badly to be there!	I bet you are excited, I love going to the beach.
I am, but it's so gorgeous and it's a fantastic golf course. And I'm stuck here, bored stupid! I know, I'm being selfish.	That's fair, you have to do what you have to do!

I'm trying. Thank you for making me feel better - I really do wish him great success and happiness.	I'm so excited about an upcoming move and life change -- it's a move to a verrrry different state, but should be interesting!	That's exciting, what are you moving to?

Potentially Alaska -- Anchorage, to be specific. We've lived in different places before -- Amsterdam, Zurich, and Hong Kong. And even though it's a US state, it feels foreign somehow!	That's a pretty interesting place. What are some things you like about it?
I feel so relaxed and at peace when I meditate	I'm sorry you feel that way. I don't know how that is possible.
No mystic events. I just feel really relaxed and happy.	I'm happy for you!  It's been a tough year for me.
My traveling is more like a sleep / trance, or hypnosis	Once, I thought somebody was attempting to break into my house.	I am sure it was an intruder!
Yes, I was truly frightened. It ended up being okay though. It was actually just a roofer inspecting my roof that nobody told me about.	That is not good at all. I hope you are okay now.

I felt so let down by a person who promised me a project -- but then pulled it away at the last minute in a way that was very personal and reactionary.	That is a bummer. Did you talk to them about it?
Especially when it's based on emotion versus honoring a commitment. And when they know it has a very real economic impact.	That is a pretty harsh way to put it.  What are you talking about?
I had to give a presentation in front of my entire University class last semester. I hate presenting things.	That is awful. What happened?
Honestly, I took a xanax beforehand. It was a group presentation also which helped take some of the spotlight off of me.	That's good! You're still a good presenter.

I went to the local Farmers Market and bought some produce from a farm stall. I am disabled and the kind farmer, despite being busy with other customers, took the time to take my purchases to my car. What a wonderful, kind man!	That is so nice. What did you buy?
Not at all. They were super nice, and just kept getting together what they wanted to buy. I love living here - such nice people.	That is a great community to live in.  What city are you in?
Sure! There's plenty of room, lol. Just be sure you like hot, steamy summers and lots of golf fanatics!	I like hot, steamy summers! I think you should pack light and wear sunscreen.

I get your point - used to live in NE Florida myself. Well, this farmer fella is going to get lots of business from me, that's for sure.	I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck in the barn.	That is scary! What did you do to stop the wasp?
Next time I will get stung somewhere besides my neck	What is it going to be?
Maybe I should bring a can of wasp spray!	So I work at a UPS Store. I once gave a customer the wrong package that was valued at $700.	Oh no, that must have been frustrating for you to deal with.

Luckily, they were customers that we knew really well and they had a mailbox at our store. So they brought it back when we explained what happened. I felt awful though.	That's so nice of them. I bet you felt bad.
I've been reminiscing recently about the good old days, when I was a kid and didn't have to worry about bills and expenses.	I can relate. I have a lot of fond memories of my childhood.
Yes! I wished so much that I would be an adult so I could make my own decisions. Now I wish I could have someone else make those decisions for me! haha	I know what you mean!
I love what I do because it's about both inspiring and empowering people to be their best and to excel at their jobs.	That's awesome, I hope that you continue to do what you love.
I work as a facilitator and team trainer -- mostly with a company who I truly love and respect for walking their talk.	That's great, you must be very happy to work for them.

I waited for a good friend of mine at a local pub recently - 2 hours I waited. Eventually I got hold of him and he said he couldn't be bothered going out and had forgotten to call. Not too impressed, frankly.	That is awful! I would be very upset.

I bought a pint of beer and a curry and joined another single woman at a table. We had a fine time, but I sure am wondering about my friendship!	That sounds like a lot of fun. I hope you find a good girlfriend soon.
Could be. I just feel he was being rather inconsiderate, which is not something I'd expect of him.	What did he do?

Kind of what I was thinking. I won't be arranging to meet him again for a while, that's for sure!	I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.	That's crazy! I bet you're really happy for her!
She won $5,000 and never offered to share.	That's a good one.  She's lucky to have a friend like you!
I recently aced a circuits exam that I was very confident in.	I am sure you did.

I wouldn't say naturally smart, it took a good amount of planning to do well. We established a study group about 2 weeks before the test which helped alot.	That's good, you must be very confident in your abilities now.
I am anticipating that the limestone mine in my area where I live at will be reclaimed.	That is good news!  Are you planning on going back there?
Clean up, stabilize from future collapses, demolish vacant houses open closed roads, and so on	Wow, you're quite ambitious. What's your plan?

I had a rather unnerving experience this past winter. Being unable to sleep at 4am, I went outside for a cigarette (I live in an apartment complex). Suddenly, out of the darkness, appeared a tall bulky figure dressed in black. They were coming straight at me!	That sounds terrifying. What did you do?

Well, I'm in a wheelchair, so can't move too quickly. I just sat looking at them, trying to figure out whether I could reach the broom at the corner of the porch.	That sounds very frustrating.  It is very hard to find things in a wheelchair.

Well, that would have been an option. The person came right up to my porch and said "Good morning. Can't sleep either?" It was my friend and neighbor walking her dog and I didn't recognize her with all her winter gear on. Scared the daylights out of me!	My daughter just got married and moved across the country and is homesick. I've been talking to her every day to make her feel better.	That's awesome.  Did she come visit?

Actually, I did! I moved across the world to Doha, Qatar to teach for a couple of years. Even though my husband and daughter was with me, it was very hard to be away. Have you ever moved far away?	I have, but I did it for work, so it was worth it.
I had to give a presentation in front of my college class and it didn't go so well.	That's horrible! I hope you at least learned something from it.
There was a lot of stuttering and red-face going on. Also, technical difficulties.	That's terrible, what happened?
Sometimes when people honk in traffic I don't know whether to get angry or be glad!	Well, I'd probably be glad! I hate getting honked at.
Exactly, I think a lot of people are too cautious while driving, which makes things even less safe	I agree. I have never been in an accident.
I recently got accepted to an Electrical Engineering program at my school.	That is awesome!
I was very excited when I found out. Have you ever been accepted to anything that you really wanted before?	I was accepted to a college I had never been to before. It was a big deal for me.
I was really frightened the other night. I was home alone and there was a big storm.	Oh no! Did you hear any thunder?
Fortunately, it didn't, but there was a LOT of thunder and lightning. I think a lot of places are being hit by storms right now. Please stay safe!	I hope the storms go away quickly.

I was quite distressed to hear of the passing of Anthony Bourdain. That someone who has given so much joy to a huge number of people should take his own life is just awful.	I agree. He was a great person.
Indeed. Depression is a terrible disease and there simply aren't enough resources devoted to mental illness, imo.	I agree, I've never been able to get over my depression, but I've been working on it.

It is. I read his book Kitchen Confidential. He's been battling addiction and demons all his life. I thought he'd found peace, but I guess not.	My work supervisor came into my store recently. I tucked in my shirt, left home early, and even put my name badge on for the special occasion.	Oh wow! I bet he was impressed.
I had a great time keeping my job and not being fired! I was on the ball for his visit.	Did you get a raise?
I am going to my local amusement park tomorrow and feeling a certain way about it!	Oh, that sounds fun! What amusement park?
I am indeed. I am ready to go and ride all of the rides, roller coasters especially! Do you have a favorite theme park?	I do!  My favorite is Universal Studios.  The thrill rides are so much fun!
I recently started putting part of my paychecks into a savings account. I have almost $1000 now.	That is awesome! I wish I had a savings account.

That may take awhile, but for the moment I have a nice emergency fund and am prepared for whatever may come my way.	Oh that's good!  I've been trying to get my finances in order for a while now, and it's great to hear that you're on the right track!
We all were excited when my sister came home for Christmas. She brought her whole family.	That's great. Did you have a lot of guests?
Haha! Nobody ever dresses as Santa, but the kids still believe in Santa which is very fun.	I have had those kids. They are the best.
I was very upset when I came home to find that my dog had torn up my living room sofa.	Oh no! That's terrible! Did you get it?
That's horrible, but looking back in the future it will be funny hopefully. My dog I thought had been trained, but she clearly had not!	That's horrible. I am sorry. What was your dog's name?
I think tv shows make me into a mushy person at times.	I'm a big fan of TV shows.
Everything really, I just know I'm going to cry if it's sad even if I've seen it before.	I know what you mean. I've seen so many sad movies that I have to cry, but I still enjoy them.

Nah, I don't get to to bad.	I am very much looking forward to going to Busch Gardens next week with my family!	That sounds like a lot of fun!  I've been to Busch Gardens a couple times.  What do you think you're going to do?
I do too. Did you go to the one in Williamsburg or in Tampa?	I did, but I didn't go to the one in Tampa.  I went to the one in Williamsburg.  It was pretty cool.
Little kids really have no clue about germs I think.	I agree. Kids are so simple.
This kid dropped his candy bar and then picked it up and ate it.	Oh man. How did you react?
Not even a little.	What's not even a little?
I can not believe how loyal my dogs are to me. I am so thankful that they will let me give medicine to them without putting up a fight.	That is so nice of them!

Well, right now they both have an ear infection. Both of them are Golden Retrievers and they both are very gentle dogs that let me administer medicine without any problems	That is great. I hope they both get better.
I had a storm come through recently. A massive limb fell on top of my roof and now I have to replace the entire roof of my house	That's terrible!  How did you catch it?
It was very bad. The entire roof will definitely have to be replaced.	Why? What happened?
Yes, insurance will cover it thankfully. I am very lucky.	I went to a wedding. I saw many of my friends from my grade school past.	Oh that sounds fun! Did you end up dancing?
Yes I do. Some of them I am still very fond of.	That's great! What kind of people are they?
I can't wait for my family to come to town. My house is all in order for when they come.	That's great, what's it going to be like?
No, I really don't so it's special. I would have what many would call a nuclear family, you know?	I am sure it is special.
I went to my friend's niece's dance recital this weekend. I could not believe how well she did.	Did you cheer her on?
She is very young, and she stole the show. She was hilarious and stood out from all of the rest of the girls.	That's great! What were they doing?
You know you could still do it. I know you can.	I have been feeling down about my finances.
My son drove down and spent the whole weekend helping me move.	I'm so proud of you and your son!
He lives about a couple hours away, but he's young and always busy. I was very relieved to have some help as it was a BIG job!	That's good! I bet you were happy to have help!

You know sometimes when you just feel like you have to leave a job? Well, that time is now for me and I can not wait for my job interview this week.	That is awesome!  What job are you interviewing for?

It is so tempting you're absolutely right. I'm going to try and hang on though, and thanks for the advice.	I am glad I could help, but I have to say that I think you are right. I am sure you will be fine.
I found a salad in the back of my refrigerator that I forgot about. It smelled awful when I opened the container it was in.	Oh no! Did you eat it?
Yes, it went straight to the outside trash container. I was very surprised that my entire refrigerator didn't smell bad.	That's good!  Did you have to throw it out?
Thanks for that information. I'll try it out.	Last year my sister opened up her own retail store. It is doing very well, and I love going to see it.	That's really cool. What kind of store is it?

It has a lot of quirky things that most Big Box stores don't carry. It has everything from clothes for all ages, to jewelry and lots of other things.	I love that store! I have a lot of friends who go there.
I have another job so I can't do too much, but I love going in to see her.	I love seeing my mom too.  She's so sweet.

I felt very isolated when we first moved to Hong Kong -- I had a young baby and my husband pretty much needed to start traveling for business right away!	That must have been tough.  What did you do to help him get started?
It did! But there was a very vibrant and concentrated expat community -- that helped immediately!	That's great!  Did you join?

Do it! It gives such a wonderful perspective on the world. We've lived in Amsterdam and Zurich as well....and may very well move to Anchorage soon!	I think it's a great perspective to have.  I've always wanted to live in Alaska!
I recently got very sick, and I had to spend a lot of time in the hospital. I am very lucky that I have a great family that watched over me.	That is great. I hope you are feeling better now.

Not a day goes by where I'm not thankful. I'm still recovering and they are still there for me.	I am so glad that you have people in your life who care about you. I am sure that you will get through this.

I find it profoundly sad and disturbing how some people will rationalize someone else's unhinged behavior, simply to avoid admitting that maybe they made a horrible choice.	I agree, I was just thinking the other day about a friend who had a huge fight with his wife and how he just kept blaming her for everything.

We're living with it. And it's dividing us as a society. I truly hope that the upcoming months will bring big change. Definitely working for that!	I'm glad to hear that. I'm not sure about the change but I hope for it.
Me too! <fist bump> ;-)	So yesterday I found out my roommate has been dating someone for 3 months. I can't believe he didn't tell me.	That's a lot of time. I'm sure you will be okay.

He is usually a very private person. He hasn't dated anyone in the over 3 years i've lived here, and he's only ever had one friend over.	That's so cool.  I'm sure he's a great person.  I hope he finds someone soon!
I got so annoyed the other day. Got cut off in traffic.	That happens to me all the time.  What did you do?
I agree! Do people just not care about risking their own lives never mind anyone else?	I agree. People are just so selfish sometimes.
You know my parents still have not gotten over the loss of my sister.	That's really sad. What happened?
She passed two days after Christmas. She was very sick during the whole month of December.	That's so sad.

I will, and thank you so much for the encouragement.	I've been passively job hunting for a few months now, looking for a better job. I haven't had any luck yet and I'm starting to feel like I never will.	I know the feeling. I'm really looking forward to a better job.

Well I don't have any friends that are in my field or even close to it. I'm trying the best I can and am trying to find other ways to make money too.	It's okay to have a tough time in life, I'm sure you'll find the right path.
One of my much younger sister's is starting college in a couple weeks. I am so excited for her.	I bet! I have a sister who is 20, and she's starting college next month.
She told me she wants to become a dentist, but she's a little fickle. I will see what she says she wants to do in a year.	That's great. You have to be patient.
June and July are very busy, June I prep plans for July. July I have company all month.	That's so cool! I love company trips. What are you planning?
So much for relaxing during the summer?	I love summer, but the heat can be unbearable in my area.
Do you even know how crazy it is to skydive? I must have been absolutely nuts when I did it.	Yeah, I've never done it. I'm afraid.
It gave me the biggest rush that's for sure. But on the way down I was saying my prayers.	That's awesome! What's your favorite prayer?
You should do it sometime. It's fun to take chances.	You're right. I'm not really good at taking chances.
I have recently become vegan and I am very impressed with the food	I'm sorry to hear that. I know it can be hard to give up meat.

I had to start eating this way because of health reasons and I have found some amazing recipes on Pinterest.   It makes me not miss meat or dairy at all	I can relate.  I used to be a meat and dairy fanatic, but I've been trying to cut back a bit for health reasons.  I've found some really good recipes on Pinterest that make it feel like I'm eating healthy food.
I have to get these shots in my head for migraines.	Wow, that sounds so stressful.  I hope you can get through it without too much pain.

oh man that sounds like serious stuff ,and it sounds really scary as well hope everything goes great	When my mom had breast cancer a few years ago. I wanted to do everything I could to be there for her.	That's really great of you.  What did you do?
I was and she was had a full recovery.	Did you have to do anything to help?
Me neither, my mom means so much to me.	That's nice. What's the most important thing to her?
Do you get to see your mom often?	Yeah, we live right next to each other.
I saw a dodge viper in the parking lot yesterday. Probably one of the coolest American made cars!	I have never seen one of those! They are really rare!
It was blue with white racing stripes.	That's a pretty cool car.  I don't see any racing stripes on mine.
Same here, they are pretty expensive.	My dog chewed up one of my flip flops the other day. Now I have to throw them out.	That sucks. Did you find a way to get it out of him?
This is the first one she tore up. My roommate was watching her while I was out of town. I'm sorry about your shoes.	That's terrible! I hope she doesn't do that again.
My wife surprised me on my birthday with an amazing homemade dinner.	That's so nice of her. What did she make?
She made me ribs and a cheesecake for dessert.	What a nice gesture. I love when people do nice things for you.
Thank you! What is your favorite meal?	I love a good steak.
Me too, do you have a favorite flavor?	My long term boyfriend and I broke up recently. I'm so lost right now.	What happened?
I know, it's just so frustrating after spending so long building your lives together.	You have to be patient and not give up!
My grandfather invited me over and made us an awesome dinner today. I was so hungry.	That is awesome! What did he make?
He made us a pot roast with carrots and potatoes. It's melt in your mouth good.	That sounds delicious!  What did you eat?
I got a promotion in work. I am so excited for the raise and added responsibility.	I am happy for you.  I have a friend who got a promotion too.
Thank you, I am so excited. It has taken 3 years of hard work to earn this promotion.	That's great, how old are you now?
I work in the military	My daughter can say so many new words, love to see her thrive!	I bet she is a smart girl!

Yes, thank you! Having children is a wonderfull blessing. Couldn't imagine my life without my daughter. Do you have children?	I have two boys, and a daughter.  They are the best thing that has ever happened to me!
I've got all of my bags packed, passport ready, and i'm not even leaving for vacation until next week.	That's great.  You must be excited to go.
I'm going to Japan. I'm so excited, I've never been.	That sounds like a great trip!
So my parents took me out to dinner for my birthday tonight.	I hope you had a good time!
Thanks! I had an awesome time. I went to a sushi place and it was delicious.	That sounds amazing, did you have any fun activities?
I did indeed. Along with every other kind of roll that they had, haha.	That must have been quite fun.
So yesterday I went for a bike ride in my city's park. The weather was perfect!	Oh, what a great day!  What park?
It was wonderful. I felt at peace as I rode by all of the flower gardens and fountains. Do you visit any parks or gardens in your area?	I do, and I would love to visit the one in my city's park!
It's so quiet in my house, just watching tv by myself. Wish my family was around.	I understand, I'm sure you can entertain yourself.

That is a great attitude to have, my husband is in the military so he is gone a lot to other countries. My family is about 2,000 miles away in Alaska!	That's amazing! What do you do to keep everyone entertained?
Whenever we moved abroad, I learned to trust my instinct and sense of adventure.	I'm so glad you learned that!  Where did you move to?

Ah -- thank you! Definitely aware of wanting to live life to its fullest. We've recently gone through a tough time, so it feels lovely to focus on adventure again.	I'm glad to hear you are feeling good again.

Bless you! What a *relief* and how impressive! We've lived in Amsterdam, Hong Kong and Zurich -- Alaska may be next. (And Italy is awesome, by the way!)	It's my brother's 16th birthday in a couple days and he's probably getting a nicer car than I currently have. I'm 24.	That's not cool.  I'm sorry.  You should ask him if you can get a car.  It's a long way to the car dealership.

I certainly am! Of course, I can't be certain yet because I don't know what he's getting. My car is junk though so it's bound to be better.	That is good to hear. Do you have a lot of money to spend on your car?

So my brother is turning 16 soon which means I don't have to drive him around anymore. Score!	That's great!  I'm sure you're happy to have less driving duties.  You can use that time to do other things.
Yes indeed! I am very happy about it. Do you have any younger siblings?	Yes, one of them is a boy.
I saw somebody I hadn't in years. It was a nice meeting.	That's cool. Did you see what happened?
Yes it is. I am glad that I was able to speak with her.	It must have been a long time since you last talked to her.
I love the adventure and perspective of living away from my home state -- but that doesn't mean I don't miss elements of it while I'm gone!	That's a good perspective to have.

Are you able to visit often? That helps -- but it's funny how things never feel *exactly* the same, you know?	Yes, I'm able to visit them often.  I have a lot of family.  I'm not sure if I'll be able to visit often anymore though.
I went to a bar a couple days ago and was hit on by a woman.	Oh no! That sounds awful. Did she get too drunk and do something nasty?
I respectfully told her I was not interested, I already have a wife so I need to be committed. I would never cheat.	That's great! I'm glad you're committed to your wife.

I am very glad that I went and supported him.	That's great. What made you go?

No I haven't, but that's a decent idea that I may try. Thanks for the suggestion!	I'm glad I could suggest something.
So I recently made buffalo wing sauce from a new recipe I found and it turned out great!	That sounds delicious! What's the recipe?

Indeed. I feel that it is very important to stay caught up on the latest developments. And the potential for a raise isn't a bad motivator either.	I agree, I am sure that you will be able to get that raise if you work hard.
I am so excited for my baby son to be born, I am so eager for it to happen!	I am so excited for my baby son to be born, I am so eager for it to happen!

I know! Hopefully the stress levels are kept to a minimal and I have a very supporting husband who will be there every step of the way. I hope for a swift and trouble free birth.	That's great. I'm sure you'll do great.
